thread.title: Rousseau looking for right fit before summer decision
thread.title_full: Rousseau looking for right fit before summer decision

title: Rousseau looking for right fit before summer decision
text:
Rousseau looking for right fit before summer decision (Photo: Andrew Ivins, 247Sports) 
MIAMI - Outside linebacker Gregory Rousseau (6-6, 208) said Miami leads UCF, Georgia and LSU among his nine verbal offers. 
"I've visited there a lot," Rousseau said. 
He said he’s looking to play as a standup outside linebacker, preferably in a 3-4 scheme, on the next level. 
He said Oregon State, LSU, Miami and Georgia are recruiting him the hardest. 
He broke down his thoughts on each program. 
Oregon State: "They are telling me I can come there and be another good player for them like other Miami boys have done. (Beavers running backs coach Telly Lockette ) really shows me a lot of love and hits me up a lot on Twitter. 
Georgia: " James Coley is a real friendly guy and I'm just starting to get a connection with him." 
LSU: "I'm hoping to visit them in the summer and they run a 3-4 defense and be just like Arden Key for LSU." 
Miami: "I see they are on the come up. They are getting big-time recruits. Their recruiting classes are so good. I see a lot of potential." 
LSU, Miami and Georgia are recruiting him to play edge rusher. 
He plans to visit Georgia and Miami this spring. 
Oregon State, West Virginia and USC say wide receiver, per Rousseau. 
"Edge rushing is my favorite because I see the most potential there," Rousseau said. 
As a junior, Rousseau caught 28 passes for 458 yards with 10 touchdowns and racked up 55 tackles on defense. 
Rousseau would like to visit LSU, Georgia, UCF and Miami this summer before making his college choice. 
The Crystal Ball reads 100-percent for Miami for the nation’s No. 24 weakside defensive end in the 2018 class by 247SportsComposite. Author
